rev.comment: the program itself is free and open-source, under GPL v2, however, it seems the service of offering the patches is only free for certain systems. But this needs to be explained better

â
'''Ksplice''' is a free and [[open source]]{{citation needed}} extension of the [[Linux kernel]] which allows [[system administrator]]s to apply security [[patch (software)|patch]]es to a running kernel without having to reboot the [[operating system]]. Ksplice has been implemented for Linux on the [[x86-32]] and [[x86-64]] architectures. It is currently being developed by Ksplice, Inc.
+
'''Ksplice''' is a free and [[open source]] extension of the [[Linux kernel]] which allows [[system administrator]]s to apply security [[patch (software)|patch]]es to a running kernel without having to reboot the [[operating system]]. Ksplice has been implemented for Linux on the [[x86-32]] and [[x86-64]] architectures. It is currently being developed by Ksplice, Inc.
